page.title: 08Local Historic Buildings
page.content: St Giles' Church(continued) memorial stone to the Emporer Severus to commemorate his attempt to conquer Scotland. {The Chapel { }The chapel is a Methodist Chapel built in 1878.Inside the chapel it is pale blue on the roof and there is a black and pale blue circle in each corner and a black and pale blue oval in the centre.There are about 50 pews, plus dining pews.There is a service every Sunday.They also have a service at Christmas,Easter and Whitsuntide.We do not now have a Sunday School. {Dotheboys Hall Dotheboys Hall was a boys school immortalised by Dickens in "Nicholas Nickelby".The Headmaster was cruel to the boys and the pump where the boys had to wash is still in the courtyard. The Hall is now private housing.
